articles.title: About me
articles.description: I'm Ian from South Korea. I do research on linguistic typology.

articles.title: Ian Joo
articles.description: Welcome to my website, where you can know more about me and my research.

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
Koo, Jea-hyoun & Joo, Ian. 2022. Japanese-korean brush-talk during the early edo period, 1603–1867. In Li, David C. S. & Aoyama, Reijiro & Wong, Tak-Sum (eds.), Brush conversation in the sinographic cosmopolis: Interactional cross-border communication using literary sinitic in early modern east asia (Routledge Studies in the Early History of Asia). 1st edn. London; New York: Routledge.


Joo, Ian & Liu, Meichun. 2021. Caused-motion and caused-position: Syntactic patterns and semantic networks. Studies in Language 45(2). 470–498. (doi:10.1075/sl.18067.joo) (Download)


Joo, Ian. 2021. The etymology of korean ssal “uncooked grain” and pap “cooked grain”. Cahiers de linguistique Asie orientale 50(1). 94–110. (doi:10.1163/19606028-bja10013) (Download)


Joo, Ian. 2020. Phonosemantic biases found in leipzig-jakarta lists of 66 languages. Linguistic Typology 24(1). 1–12. (doi:10.1515/lingty-2019-0030) (Download)
